title: Looking for the mysterious photographer who snapped occupied Paris and mocked the Nazis
summary: 'Photographer Unknown. Paris, 1940-1942' (Part 1/5). In 2020, Le Monde learned about the discovery of an album containing 377 photos of Paris during the Occupation by Nazi Germany. Who braved the occupiers' ban on outdoor photography to take these unapproved pictures? For four years, we investigated.

title: Pope Francis's historic Asia Pacific tour: 'China is following the trip very closely'
summary: The Vatican's relations with China, the weight of Catholicism in Asia, interreligious dialogue and sexual violence are some of the issues that will come up on the Pope's trip. Singapore-based researcher Michel Chambon says that Francis is seeking to 'demonstrate the universal sovereignty of the papacy' in the region.

title: Experts describe mass rape suspect as 'self-centered' manipulator
summary: Psychologists took the stand on Monday, describing Dominique Pelicot as a man with a 'split' personality.

title: Paris 2024: Ozempic, an unwelcome official sponsor in Canada
summary: The pharmaceutical company behind the anti-diabetic drug turned into a treatment for obesity has launched a major advertising campaign through a partnership with Radio-Canada for the Olympics broadcast.

title: Extreme weather in the US: Louisiana residents brace for hurricane, residents flee fires in LA and Nevada
summary: Evacuation orders are quickly issued before Tropical Storm Francine makes landfall as a hurricane this week in Louisiana. Meanwhile, a wildfire continues to spread east of Los Angeles, driven by days of triple-digit temperatures.

title: James Earl Jones, the voice of CNN and Darth Vader, dies at 93
summary: The acclaimed actor won two Emmys, a Golden Globe, a Grammy, an honorary Oscar, and in 2022, a Broadway theater was renamed in his honor. Star Wars creator George Lucas and actor Mark Hamill were among the first ones to pay tribute to Jones.

title: Harvey Weinstein taken to NYC hospital for heart surgery
summary: The jailed ex-movie mogul underwent an emergency medical procedure at a New York City hospital on Monday to remove fluid from his heart and lungs after he complained of chest pains, his representatives said.

title: Covid-19: The controversy over deaths linked to hydroxychloroquine reignites
summary: In January, a French team estimated that 17,000 deaths had been caused in six countries among hospitalized patients receiving the drug promoted by Didier Raoult. This study has just been retracted.

title: The Olympic and Paralympic Games through the eyes of foreign media: 'Parisians remembered what an extraordinary place their city is'
summary: Many media outlets hailed the massive publicity given to para-sport, and praised a sporting event that transfigured the French capital. 'The city’s happiest collective experience since, perhaps, the Liberation in 1944,' wrote 'The Financial Times.'

title: Trial begins over Texas 'Trump Train' highway confrontation in 2020
summary: In October 2020, on a Texas highway, a Biden-Harris campaign bus was surrounded by a convoy of President Donald Trump supporters weaving close, and some passengers called 911 for help.

title: In Russia, at least 10 generals and members of former defense minister Sergei Shoigu's entourage dismissed or arrested
summary: These officials have been detained or prosecuted in fraud and corruption cases in recent months, against the backdrop of an upcoming appointment as the head of the security services (FSB).

title: Paris 2024: The most striking images of the Paralympic Games
summary: Le Monde selected the most memorable photos of the Paris Paralympic Games, from the opening ceremony at Place de la Concorde to the sporting events and the Club France parties at La Villette.

title: Morgan Wallen leads the 2024 Country Music Association award nominations, Beyoncé is snubbed
summary: For a third year in a row, Wallen is up for both the top prize – entertainer of the year – and the male vocalist categories.

title: 'Zorro': Jean Dujardin is the man behind the mask on Paramount+
summary: Midway between humorous pastiche and melancholic metafiction, this resurrection of a childish legend proves pleasantly seductive.

title: The crackdown on Maduro's opposition in Venezuela
summary: Six weeks after the July 28 presidential election, the regime in Caracas is hunting down any form of challenge to its claimed victory. Opposition candidate Edmundo Gonzalez fled to Spain on Saturday.

title: Theater adaptation of 'The Wizard of the Kremlin' is a chilling plunge into the heart of Russian power
summary: In a laboratory-like setting, Roland Auzet stages the fictional story of a 21st-century tsar-maker who takes us into the arcane world of fascism.

title: War in Gaza takes center stage at Perpignan photojournalism festival
summary: Three prizes were awarded to Gazan photographers who depicted the scale of the human death toll, against a backdrop of controversy sparked by the French city's far-right mayor.

title: Tebboune, reelected in Algeria, faces turbulent regional geopolitics
summary: Abelmadjid Tebboune will have to re-establish Algiers' strategic position, weakened by tensions along its borders with Morocco, the Sahel and Libya.

title: Gaza civil defense says 40 killed, 60 wounded in Israeli strike on humanitarian zone
summary: Hamas said in a statement on Tuesday that claims its fighters were present at the scene of the strike were 'a blatant lie.'

title: Who is Björn Höcke, leader of the German far right?
summary: Despite his outrageous outbursts, which have irritated people in his own camp, the leader of the Alternative for Germany (AfD) party led it to the top of the polls in the Thuringian regional elections – a first since the post-war period.

title: Australia plans to implement age limit to ban children from social media
summary: The age limit could be as high as 16, Prime Minister Anthony Albanese said Tuesday, September 10, vowing to get kids off their devices and 'onto the footy fields.'

title: From chaos to enchantment, the night that changed the Paris 2024 Olympics
summary: The 2024 Olympic and Paralympic Games got off to a bad start with sabotage on France's railway networks and bad weather. But in the course of one evening, the Games were transformed into a moment of collective elation that will go down in history.

title: Paris 2024: France's many post-Games challenges
summary: The Olympic and Paralympic Games organization has been widely acclaimed, but assessing the event's legacy will take time.

title: French mass rape trial: Experts dissect 'enigma' of defendant's 'split personality'
summary: On Monday, several experts appeared before the criminal court to analyse the background and 'split personality' of Dominique Pelicotn, who is accused of having drugged his wife to rape her and have her raped in her sleep by strangers for almost 10 years.

title: Rebecca Cheptegei: Man accused of fatally burning Ugandan Olympic athlete dies in hospital
summary: Dickson Ndiema Marangach sustained 30% burns after he allegedly doused the Ugandan Olympian with five liters of petrol.

title: French court upholds Yemenia Airways crash verdict
summary: The French appeals court on Tuesday upheld the 2022 ruling against Yemenia Airways over a 2009 crash that killed almost all passengers apart from a 12-year-old girl.

title: Tariq Ramadan convicted of rape on appeal in Switzerland
summary: The former Oxford University professor was charged with sexually harassing a woman in a Geneva hotel room in 2008.

title: EU court orders Apple to pay Ireland €13 billion in back taxes
summary: The case about Apple not paying sufficient taxes in Ireland, where it has its European headquarters, drew outrage from Apple when it opened in 2016 , with CEO Tim Cook dismissing it as 'total political crap.'

title: Rich gay Catholic who fantasized about Islamists tried on appeal over terrorism charges
summary: Serge D. wanted to seduce Muslim men online but ended up encouraging them to join the jihad. Sentenced to three years' imprisonment, with two suspended, he was tried on appeal on Monday.

title: 2024 US election: Harris and Trump to debate in key TV moment for a tight race
summary: Kamala Harris and Donald Trump are due to face off on ABC on Tuesday. The vice president, whose profile is still unclear for some Americans, will try to win over undecided and moderate conservative voters.

title: Israel strikes Gaza humanitarian zone, killing at least 40
summary: The Israeli army said it carried out the strikes on the Al-Mawasi camp in Khan Yunis to target 'significant' members of Hamas.

title: French mass rape trial: Pelicot questioning postponed as defendant 'still unwell'
summary: Dominique Pelicot, accused of drugging his wife to repeatedly rape her and enabling dozens of other men to rape her, initially withdrew from the trial on medical reasons on Monday.

title: Israeli strike on Gaza humanitarian zone death toll revised to at least 19
summary: Gaza's Civil Defense authorities put the initial death toll from the overnight strike at 40, but the enclave's Ministry of Health corrected the figure to at least 19 people.

title: Jordan reopens West Bank crossing after deadly attack
summary: Israel's army shot dead an attacker at the Allenby Crossing on Sunday after killing three Israeli guards.

title: Algeria's disputed election results and low turnout taint president's re-election
summary: The three candidates' campaigns, including that of re-elected President Abdelmadjid Tebboune, have accused the National Independent Authority for Elections of 'irregularities' and 'contradictions.'

title: France, Germany and UK issue new sanctions over Iran's missile deliveries to Russia
summary: The European Union on Monday announced that its allies had shared intelligence that Iran had supplied Russia with ballistic missiles, and warned of new sanctions on Tehran.

title: Paris teacher suspended for hitting 3-year-old pupil
summary: The suspension was announced the day after the release of a video, recorded by a pupil's mother, showing this teacher at a nursery school delivering a violent blow to the back of a tearful pupil.

title: Mario Draghi's competitiveness report: EU condemned to 'slow agony' if no change
summary: In a 400-page report, the former ECB president analyzes why the EU is lagging behind the US and China, and calls for more joint borrowing and investment.

title: France's politicians all say they want to 'break with the past.' But do they really?
summary: At a time when French political mistrust is at its highest and everyone is declaring a break with the past, continuity is what is prevailing. The paradox reflects the extreme confusion on the political scene, analyzes Le Monde's Françoise Fressoz in her column.

title: Algerian presidential candidate appeals election result
summary: Three days after Algeria's presidential election, opposition candidate Abdelaali Hassani, head of the Movement of Society for Peace party, filed an official appeal, citing 'false figures' and widely contested turnout rates.

title: Vincent Labrune re-elected head of France's football league
summary: Vincent Labrune was re-elected president of France's football league on Tuesday. He will serve another 4-year term.

title: ECB accused of stifling growth in Europe
summary: The European Central Bank may cut interest rates at its meeting on Thursday. But is the move coming too late and too slow?

title: Death toll from boat that capsized off coast of Senegal rises
summary: The captain of the boat, which was filled with dozens of people hoping to get to Europe, turned himself in on Tuesday.

title: EU top court delivers 'big win' against Apple and Google
summary: In two back-to-back rulings, the European Court of Justice gave the Union's regulators two major victories in their ongoing battles with tech giants, judging that Apple and Google must pay over €15 billion in total.

title: US unveils sanctions against Iran after missiles delivery to Russia
summary: The decision comes after the UK, France and Germany already announced sanctions against Iran earlier on Tuesday.

title: France's first lady Brigitte Macron makes cameo in new 'Emily in Paris' episode
summary: The idea of the cameo emerged after the series' creator Darren Star and the show's star Lily Collins met Emmanuel Macron's wife at the Elysée Palace in December 2022, Elle magazine revealed. The second half of the fourth season is being released Thursday on Netflix.

title: Nestlé to pay 2 million euros to close France water probes
summary: The deal ends preliminary probes into the use of wells without authorization and fraud for filtering its mineral waters, a practice that is illegal in France where mineral waters are supposed to be natural.
